definitions.definition: Describing the chemical composition or temperature of a mixture of substances that gives the lowest temperature at which the mixture becomes fully molten . A further requirement is that that temperature is lower than the melting point of any of the pure component substances.
Describing the thermodynamic equilibrium conditions where a liquid coexists with two solid phases .
examples: For a mixture with two components at a fixed pressure, the eutectic reaction can only happen at a fixed chemical composition and temperature , called the eutectic point.

main_definition: Describing the chemical composition or temperature of a mixture of substances that gives the lowest temperature at which the mixture becomes fully molten . A further requirement is that that temperature is lower than the melting point of any of the pure component substances.
secondary_definitions: ( chemistry ) Describing the thermodynamic equilibrium conditions where a liquid coexists with two solid phases .
